article:
'Hexokinase-1' is an enzyme that in humans is encoded by the HK1 gene.

 {{PBB_Summary
| section_title = summary_text = Hexokinases phosphorylate glucose to produce
| glucose-6-phosphate, thus committing glucose to the glycolytic pathway. This
| gene encodes a ubiquitous form of hexokinase which localizes to the outer
| membrane of mitochondria. Mutations in this gene have been associated with
| hemolytic anemia due to hexokinase deficiency. Alternative splicing of this
| gene results in five transcript variants which encode different isoforms, some
| of which are tissue-specific. Each isoform has a distinct N-terminus; the
| remainder of the protein is identical among all the isoforms. A sixth
| transcript variant has been described, but due to the presence of several stop
| codons, it is not thought to encode a protein.
}}
